definitions: To prefer or choose (something or someone) over another.
To treat (someone) with special kindness or give an advantage to.
To resemble (a parent or other relative) in appearance.
To provide support for or be advantageous to.
examples: I favour the red dress over the blue one.
The teacher tends to favour certain students.
She favours her mother's side of the family.
The weather conditions favour a fast race.
